definition: to atone for one's crime/to buy freedom from punishment/redemption/atonement
to atone for one's crimes by meritorious acts
Yom Kippur or Day of Atonement (Jewish holiday)
the Yom Kippur war of October 1973 between Israel and her Arab neighbors

sentences.english: Now we have a chance to redeem ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 現在，我們有機會將功贖罪了。

sentences.english: He shall also burn the fat of the sin offering on the altar.
sentences.chinese: 贖罪祭牲的脂油要在壇上焚燒。

sentences.english: My love is atoning to you.
and offer it on the altar, together with the grain offering, and make atonement for him, and he will be clean.
sentences.chinese: 把燔祭和素祭獻在壇上爲他贖罪，他就潔淨了。

sentences.english: And by reason hereof he ought, as for the people, so also for himself, to offer for sins.
sentences.chinese: 故此他理當爲百姓和自己獻祭贖罪。

sentences.english: Didn't you dread going to hell after death? This is your last chance to atone.
sentences.chinese: 你不怕死後下地獄嗎？這是你贖罪的機會。
但是這和贖罪有什麼關係？

sentences.english: And he shall put his hand upon the head of the burnt offering； and it shall be accepted for him to make atonement for him.
sentences.chinese: 他要按手在燔祭牲的頭上，燔祭便蒙悅納，爲他贖罪。

sentences.english: Churchgoers who attend confession are often asked to repeat the prayer as penance for sins.
sentences.chinese: 教徒在告解後常被要求覆誦聖母經爲所犯罪行贖罪。

sentences.english: I do not wish to expiate, but to live.
Their sins are washed away by Christ's atoning sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌爲世人贖罪作出的犧牲，洗去了他們的罪過。

sentences.english: He is to slaughter the lamb in the holy place where the sin offering and the burnt offering are slaughtered.
sentences.chinese: 把公羊羔宰於聖地，就是宰贖罪祭牲和燔祭牲之地。

sentences.english: And one he-goat for a sin - offering;
sentences.chinese: 又要獻一隻公山羊爲贖罪祭。

sentences.english: And that, I believe, is what true redemption is, Amir jan, when guilt leads to good.
sentences.chinese: 而真正的贖罪是從罪惡感中走向良善。

sentences.english: Aaron shall bring the bull for his own sin offering to make atonement for himself and his household, and he is to slaughter the bull for his own sin offering.
sentences.chinese: 亞倫要把贖罪祭的公牛牽來宰了，爲自己和本家贖罪。

sentences.english: Aaron shall bring the bull for his own sin offering to make atonement for himself and his household, and he is to slaughter the bull for his own sin offering.
sentences.chinese: 亞倫要把贖罪祭的公牛牽來宰了，爲自己和本家贖罪。

definition: to suffer a calamity/to suffer (e.g. under torture)/distress
to reform and start afresh (idiom); to turn over a new leaf
